üá¨üáß LACK OF KNOWLEDGE, IGNORANCE OR MISUNDERSTANDED INTENT?

Unfortunately, we will start the new year on our site with unpleasant news - the new director of the Czech National Gallery, Alicja Knast, announced in the media that her program will focus on "our colonial past in Central Europe". Let's break this claim down a bit.

I won't hide that this statement made me quite confused, perhaps I should rather use the word pissed off. Every moderately educated person knows that Central and Eastern European nations not only never had any colonies, but on the contrary, they were basically colonized by Germans, Turks and Tatars for centuries. At the same time, this subjugation or colonialism, was sometimes as cruel as the western one. Hundreds of thousands of slavic women and children were taken from the Balkans by the Turks, any resistance to the Ottoman power was brutally punished. The same fate befell approximately 20,000 inhabitants of south Moravia during the siege of Vienna in 1683. Every year in the east, the Tatars so-called "harvested the steppes", that is, they captured and took thousands of Russians, Ukrainians and Poles into slavery. When the soldiers of Empress Catherine the Great conquered Crimea from the Tatars, they found tens of thousands of suffering Eastern Europeans in chains. According to the estimate of polish, russian and ukrainian historians  from hundreds of thousands to milions of Slavs and other Eastern Europeans were taken into slavery in about 4 centuries (from the 14th to the 18th century). The Czech lands, Poland and the Baltics were also the target of german expansion, which also definitely did not act gently and several times we were really close to following the sad fate of the Polabian Slavs and completely disappearing from the ethnic and linguistic map of Europe...

It is a shame, therefore, that after all these centuries of our ancestors making sacrifices to win freedom for our enslaved peoples from foreign rule, there are some people who try to blame us for predatory Western colonialism. I find it highly disrespectful in this context. I would therefore be happy if the director clarified her statements and put them into context - who knows, maybe I just misunderstood and her intention is actually different. Perhaps her goal is actually to point out the suffering of Central and Eastern Europeans under foreign rule. That is also possible, and in that case I am willing to set the record straight and apologize to the director. However, if she meant it the way it seems now, she should apologize to all of us.

In conclusion, forgive me for perhaps choosing a little strong words in my text, but I find it difficult to express and ventilate the mixture of sadness and anger that this injustice has caused me. It's like someone labeling the poor victim of violence as the perpetrator, blaming and berating her, while the real perpetrator laughs nearby. Or as if someone came to India or Africa and blamed the crimes of colonialism on the local population instead of the former colonial powers.

If you agree with me, share this post further so that the voice of our ancestors suffering during german, turkish and tatar colonial rule will reach the ears of people who, for some unknown reason, confuse the perpetrator with the victim. Thank you.

üá¨üáß FROM THE CZECH NOBLE WOMAN TO THE CROWN PRINCESS OF BRAZIL

You might not know that the south american country of Brazil was an empire for much of the 19th century. Already during the Napoleonic Wars, it was elevated from a colony to an independent kingdom within the Portuguese Empire, and subsequently became completely independent following an agreement between members of the Portuguese royal dynasty of Bragan√ßa. Prince Pedro, who declared himself the first emperor of Brazil, sat on the newly created throne. However, the exotic south american monarchy did not last long, only 2 emperors took turns on the throne - the already mentioned Pedro I. and subsequently his son Pedro II., who was overthrown by a republican coup in 1889 üëëüáßüá∑

As he had no male followers, his daughter Isabela, who married french prince from the Orleans branch of the Bourbon dynasty, was recognized as the (now only de iure, not de facto) empress of Brazil. Together they founded the new Bragan√ßa-Orle√°ns dynasty. After the republican coup in Brazil, the family had to go into exile in France, where their son Pedro III grew up, but he had very limited opportunities for career both in Brazil, where the family was banned from entering for several decades, and in France as well. He therefore decided to go into the service of the austro-hungarian emperor, at whose court he began to build a career in the army. And it was in the imperial service that he felt in love with the czech noblewoman Al≈æbƒõta Dob≈ôensk√° of Dob≈ôenice, originally from a lordly, later baronial family. The young noblewoman was considered a bright and very charming woman who knew several languages and had an artistic talent for painting. They stayed together for a while at her native chateau in Chotƒõbo≈ô, and then the couple moved to France, where they got married in 1908. However, it must be said that the crown prince had to push through this marriage despite his family, as it was not possible at that time for a member of the imperial or royal family to marry a member of the lower nobility. Such a marriage was considered unequal, and prince Pedro was forced to renounce his claim to the brazilian throne. He remained prince, but his younger brother Luis has since been considered a potential successor. Later, however, he questioned his abdication of the throne, which is why some historians still consider him the rightful emperor and his czech wife Al≈æbƒõta (Elizabeth) as the empress. As the republican establishment continued in Brazil at the time, however, these considerations are rather hypothetical.

In the 1920s, the dynasty was allowed to return to the country and was allowed to use a palace in the city of Petropolis, the traditional imperial seat. The couple became involved in social life and gained considerable popularity in the media and among the general public. They also raised 5 children together, and thanks to this, a part of the brazilian imperial family still has czech slavic blood in their veins. After the death of her husband, Al≈æbƒõta moved to Sintra, Portugal, where she lived until her death in 1951. Her remains were later transferred to the family tomb of the brazilian emperors in the city of Petropolis.

In the first picture, you can see the coats of arms of both spouses - the cross with the globe belongs to the Bragan√ßa-Orle√°ns dynasty, the stork is the traditional coat of arms of the Dob≈ôensk√Ω z Dob≈ôenic noble family; the second picture shows Al≈æbƒõta Dob≈ôensk√° herself.

üá¨üáß Today we have 17 th November and in the Czech republic we together commemorate the significant historical events in the history of our Homeland. Everything started in 1939, when apprentice and baker's  journeyman from √öst√≠ nad Labem V√°clav Sedl√°ƒçek was buried on 4th November and medicine student Jan Opletal from Lhota nad Moravou on the 15th November (see the picture below), both the victims of a violent suppression of demonstrations during the 20th anniversary of Czechoslovakia on 28th October by Germans. the students went to the streets to protest against the german occupiers, sang patriotic songs and called slogans about the freedom of our country. The german nazis dispersed all assemblies violently and used it as an pretext to launch repressive actions against czech students and czech nation at all. Czech universities were closed, leaders of students were arrested and 9 of them executed, more than a thousand czech students were taken to concentration camps. Based on these events 17th November was announced in November 1941 as the International day of students.

Let us take a moment now and remember the people, who were not afraid to defend our country in this dark time.
HONOR TO THESE HEROES! üá®üáøüá®üáø

üá¨üáß THE UNIQUE BRUTALIST MONUMENT IN BURGAS

Gray concrete surfaces, cut geometric lines, roughly carved shapes, simplicity and at the same time monumentality - this is how the architectural style called Brutalism, which gained ground especially in the second half of the 20th century, could be briefly described. In addition to socialist realism, it found its application in the countries of the Eastern bloc, where a number of very interesting brutalist buildings were created, which amaze us with their special and unique aesthetics to this day üè¢

One of them is the Monument to the Fallen in the Fight Against Fascism in Burgas, Bulgaria, which is (as the name already suggests) dedicated to the local heroes of the anti-fascist resistance during the Second World War. The monument was created in 1981 based on the collaboration of architects Bogdan Tomalevski and Nikola Antonov with sculptor Valentin Starchev, who together proposed the construction of a circular floor plan with embedded sculptures symbolizing the breaking of shackles and the achievement of freedom ‚úåüèªüáßüá¨

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
üá¨üáß After some slavic states, including Poland and Czechoslovakia, were occupied by nazi Germany at the very beginning of the Second World War, many patriots went abroad, where they persistently and determinedly continued the fight against the german occupiers. Some of them to the East to the USSR, others to the West to Great Britain. In the United Kingdom, they mainly joined the Royal Air Force and within it participated in battles against the german Luftwaffe. It is interesting that the RAF squadrons made up of members of the slavic nations were among the best.

No. 303 (Polish) RAF Squadron is often cited as the most successful air unit with the greatest number of aircraft shot down during the Battle of Britain, which achieved a total of 297 confirmed shot down, 35 probable shot down and 25 serious damage to german machines during its existence. It distinguished itself especially in the defense of London ‚úàÔ∏èüáµüá±üá¨üáß

The squadron bore the honorary name of Tadeusz Ko≈õciuszko, a 19th-century polish national hero and fighter for polish independence, and its unofficial emblem was the cap of Ko≈õciuszko's rebels with their signature weapon - a modified scythe. The pilots mainly flew the Hawker Hurricane, Supermarine Spitfire, and later, towards the end of the war, the Mustang IV. The flying aces with the greatest number of kills were Witold Urbanowicz, Jan Zumbach or Czech Josef Franti≈°ek. The unit briefly operated after the war until 1946, when it was officially disbanded.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
üá¨üáß Albina Mali-Hoƒçevar was a brave yugoslav partisan and national hero who fought against the german occupiers during World War II üá∏üáÆüá≠üá∑üáßüá¶üá∑üá∏üá≤üá™üá≤üá∞

She was born in 1925 in the village of Vinica into a poor working-class family as one of a total of nine children. She didn't have an easy childhood and adolescence, her father died soon and only her mother had to take care of a large family with her modest income. The life of the young lady was significantly affected by the Second World War, when Yugoslavia was divided into parcels by Germany, its fascist allies and domestic collaborators, which Albina didn‚Äôt want to accept. Right from the start, she therefore joined Tito's partisans, where she first served as a liaison officer, and later actively participated in combat operations, especially in the territory of Slovenia. She was only 16 years old at that time. After suffering her first injury, she decided to focus on working as a nurse in a partisan hospital. Even so, she was wounded several more times in the fighting, including a devastating facial injury caused by a grenade explosion that scarred her face forever.

After the liberation of the country, she was awarded the title "Hero of Yugoslavia", which was awarded to a total of 91 women, of which only 19 survived the war (the others received it in memoriam). After the war, she also got married and raised 5 children. She died in 2001 at the age of 75.

On the left picture you can see the face of this strong and brave woman after she suffered a serious facial injury, on the right is a reconstruction of her face, how it would probably look if there was no Second World War...

üá¨üáß KOSOVO IS THE HEART OF SERBIA, STOP THE VIOLENCE

With this message written on the camera lens, after winning the match, the famous Serbian tennis player Novak Djokovic addressed the audience to draw attention to the new wave of violence and repression against the native serbian population, which was once again unleashed by the self-proclaimed "government" of the internationally unrecognized "state of Kosovo".

Our (czech) media bring headlines like "Serbs didn't go to the elections, now they are demonstrating against albanian mayors" or "Serbian protesters attacked NATO peacekeepers". The articles themselves are written in a similar way, which directly shows either an absolute misunderstanding of the whole situation or a completely obvious attempt at manipulation. I am of the opinion that the majority of czech media and journalists in recent years have completely resigned to any (even minimal) attempt at objectivity, and therefore their role in informing the public must be played by others. So we will explain what exactly is happening in the area right now in this post.

HOW THE CURRENT SITUATION STARTED AND WHAT IT IS ABOUT

I will now pass over centuries of historical development and the dubious process that resulted in the entity called the "Kosovo State" and go directly to the essence of the current dispute. When Western states created Kosovo, the Serbian minority there received several guarantees of security and equal rights. The fulfillment of some of them was a condition for the western powers to accept the creation of an independent Kosovo at all. They were mainly these two:

1. Kosovo territories with a serbian majority will get their own autonomy - Kosovo committed to this at the time of its creation
2. A union of Serbian cities in the north of the country will be officially created - Kosovo committed to this after international negotiations last year

Since, even after many promises and negotiations, none of the conditions were fulfilled, the Serbs decided not to participate in the regional elections held in April of this year in protest, thus expressing their disapproval of the Kosovo leadership. Voter turnout in majority serbian regions barely reached 4 percent. According to the current Kosovo laws, the elections should have been annulled with such a low turnout, but instead they were dubiously recognized as valid, and the government decided to install the "elected" mayors (actually rather occupation administrators) in the serbian cities with the help of violence. Columns of armored vehicles accompanied by heavy-duty troops drove into the north of Kosovo. Local people, worn down by years of discrimination, immediately began to protest against this, which eventually led to a brutal attack on the demonstrators by the Kosovo police. However, the Serbs began to fight back, resulting in violent clashes.

NATO troops called KFOR are currently operating in Kosovo, which are supposed to officially oversee peace in the country and prevent ethnic violence. However, they completely failed in the current situation, betrayed their mission, openly joined the side of the Kosovo albanian police and started attacking unarmed serbian demonstrators together with them. The result of the "work" of the self-proclaimed Kosovo police and KFOR units is over 50 seriously injured people who were only asking for what the Kosovo government and Western states had previously promised them. On the other side, around 20 are injured. Even US Secretary of State Anthony Blinken condemned the confrontational policy of Kosovo's representatives, Russia and China expressed support for the Serbs, Western European representatives called on both sides to negotiate. We continue to monitor the situation.

We think that strong pressure must now be exerted on compliance with international agreements by the State of Kosovo. It is impossible for the world community in the 21st century to continue to tolerate the discrimination, wantonness and ethnic violence that Kosovo Serbs face on a daily basis. In order to ensure peace in the north of Kosovo, the international military contingent KFOR, which cannot properly fulfill its tasks, should be supplemented by the presence of the serbian army and military units of neutral states. Under this patronage, the promised serbian autonomy could finally be established and the rights of all national minorities ensured. Unfortunately, such a scenario is not likely under the current situation, but nevertheless I hope that I will eventually live to see the day when no one harms Slavs in Kosovo or anywhere else in the world...

üá¨üáß SLAVIC STRUGGLE FOR LIFE AND FREEDOM - THE SUFFERING OF THE CITY OF KHARKOV DURING THE SECOND WORLD WAR

The city of Kharkov was one of the most important soviet cities and the largest industrial centers. It had almost a million inhabitants, more than 70 large factories were located here, including the one where the T-34 tanks were first produced. Also, railways bringing iron ore from Krivoy Rog, coal from Donbas and oil from Baku converged here. Everything Hitler wanted for his campaign was here, and he even explicitly mentioned the city several times during the planning of Operation Barbarossa.

Despite attempts at defense by the Red Army, Kharkov was already occupied on 24th October 1941 by units under the command of Walter von Reichenau. Just before that, however, the Soviets managed to dismantle most of the factory's machinery and transport it to a safe area where they could continue producing war material. A few cruel years began for the inhabitants of the city. In the worst situation was half a million war refugees, whom the german occupation administration did not care about at all. Families with children and old people died in the streets by the thousands from hunger and cold, while the Wehrmacht requisitioned all food supplies for its own use. Other residents were therefore not much better off. Brutal repression began almost immediately. Right at the beginning, the german occupiers shot 200 people who they believed had detonated explosives in several important locations in the city. However, they were left there by the Red Army even before its withdrawal. What followed was a massive wave of arrests, torture and killing of anyone the Germans suspected of resistance activity; the infamous Einsatzgruppe C began to operate in the city and killed tens of thousands of Slavs and Jews. Soviet prisoners of war were also mistreated there. 

Hope was brought by February 1943, when the Red Army managed to fight its way into the city again and bring food supplies to the starving civilians. The Soviets tried to turn Kharkov into a giant fortress that would withstand the next german attack - barricades were built, trenches were dug in parks, cannons and machine guns were placed in strategic positions. However, even this did not prevent the reoccupation of the city by SS units.

The definitive turning point came a few months later, when the Germans lost the Battle of Kursk. Soviet troops approached the city and began to surround it. At that moment, the german commanders decided to withdraw from the city in order to prevent the destruction of their units. Kharkov was thus liberated after 22th August, 1943, which is also reminded by the soviet-era poster attached to this post.

Just before that, however, the Soviets managed to dismantle most of the factory's machinery and transport it to a safe area where they could continue producing war material. A few cruel years began for the inhabitants of the city. In the worst situation was half a million war refugees, whom the german occupation administration did not care about at all. Families with children and old people died in the streets by the thousands from hunger and cold, while the Wehrmacht requisitioned all food supplies for its own use. Other residents were therefore not much better off. Brutal repression began almost immediately. Right at the beginning, the german occupiers shot 200 people who they believed had detonated explosives in several important locations in the city. However, they were left there by the Red Army even before its withdrawal. What followed was a massive wave of arrests, torture and killing of anyone the Germans suspected of resistance activity; the infamous Einsatzgruppe C began to operate in the city and killed tens of thousands of Slavs and Jews. Soviet prisoners of war were also mistreated there. 

Hope was brought by February 1943, when the Red Army managed to fight its way into the city again and bring food supplies to the starving civilians. The Soviets tried to turn Kharkov into a giant fortress that would withstand the next german attack - barricades were built, trenches were dug in parks, cannons and machine guns were placed in strategic positions. However, even this did not prevent the reoccupation of the city by SS units.

The definitive turning point came a few months later, when the Germans lost the Battle of Kursk. Soviet troops approached the city and began to surround it. At that moment, the german commanders decided to withdraw from the city in order to prevent the destruction of their units. Kharkov was thus liberated after 22th August, 1943, which is also reminded by the soviet-era poster attached to this post.

üá¨üáß WE WERE AND WE WILL BE!

‚ÄúWe were and we will be!" - a still valid strong message from Sokol movement for everyone in the world who wishes to see the Slavic nations humiliated and on their knees.

The truth is, however, that we started the 21st century in the worst possible way - poverty, economic depression, economic and political subordination to others, widespread corruption, the bleak social situation of entire population groups, inequality, the decline of the countryside and peripheral regions, a demographic disaster, opinionally divided societies and, last but not least, malignant nationalism resulting in mutual wars and violent conflicts. All this is the reality of the Slavic world today. 

But let's keep in mind that every decline is an opportunity for a new beginning and it is up to all of us to correct the gross mistakes of the recent past and reverse the unfortunate developments of recent decades. That is why I believe and hope that we will succeed and together we will start writing a new and better chapter in the history of our nations. However, there is a huge amount of work ahead of us and it is time to start now‚Ä¶

üá¨üáß Today we have 17 th November and in the Czech republic we together commemorate the significant historical events in the history of our Homeland. Everything started in 1939, when apprentice and baker's journeyman from √öst√≠ nad Labem V√°clav Sedl√°ƒçek was buried on 4th November (postmortem photo on the right) and medicine student Jan Opletal from Lhota nad Moravou on the 15th November (photo from his funeral on the left), both the victims of a violent suppression of demonstrations during the 20th anniversary of Czechoslovakia on 28th October by Germans. the students went to the streets to protest against the german occupiers, sang patriotic songs and called slogans about the freedom of our country. The german nazis dispersed all assemblies violently and used it as an pretext to launch repressive actions against czech students and czech nation at all. Czech universities were closed, leaders of students were arrested and 9 of them executed, more than a thousand czech students were taken to concentration camps. Based on these events 17th November was announced in November 1941 as the International day of students.

The names of the 9 student representatives executed on 17th November:

1. Jan ƒåern√Ω - chairman of the Association of Czechoslovak Medics
2. Josef Adamec - vice-chairman of the Central Union of Czechoslovak Students
3. Bed≈ôich Koula - spokesperson of the student organization of the National Union
4. Josef Matou≈°ek - historian of the Archive of the Bohemian land
5. V√°clav ≈†affr√°nek - chairman of the Student Social Action in Prague
6. Jan Weinert - chairman of the Union of Czech Students in Bohemia
7. Franti≈°ek Skorkovsk√Ω - chairman of the foreign department of the National Union of Czech Students in Bohemia and Moravia
8. Marek Frauwirth - member of the Union of poor and progressive students
9. Jaroslav Kl√≠ma - chairman of the National Union of Czech Students in Bohemia and Moravia

Let us take a moment now and remember the people, who were not afraid to defend our country in this dark time.
HONOR TO THESE HEROES! üá®üáøüá®üáø

üá¨üáß On this day we commemorate the anniversary of the event, which significantly influenced the development and direction of the Slavs in the 20th century. After the shots from the cruiser Aurora on 7th November 1917 broke out the Great October Socialist Revolution, which swept the interim government of Alexander Kerensky and instead established a government of Soviets with a dominant representation of the Bolsheviks. The subsequent course of history is known - first in Russia broke out the civil war, which ended in the victory of the Reds, then the USSR was created and eventually all culminated after World War II by establishing the Eastern bloc of socialist states, which included all slavic countries and nations, and which was one of the two strongest power blocs in the world...

üá¨üáß I STOPPED FOR A WHILE AGAIN

On 28th September, we commemorated St. Wenceslas, the patron saint of the Czech lands, and on that occasion a large patriotic manifestation of ordinary people of different ages and political opinions was held in Prague again, united by concern for our country‚Äôs future and disagreement with the politics of the current liberal government. I have to say that I personally am not a fan of large crowds or passionate chanting, street activism of any kind is not one of my hobbies, however, as a young man who often thinks about what is happening around me, I am not satisfied with the state of our country. And since I had another way around, I stopped again for a while ‚úåüèªüá®üáø

For several years I have had this persistent feeling that many things could be done differently and better. For example, I think that Eastern Europe should not continue to be an insignificant global periphery, where all that is left of the old promises of "western standards of living" are western prices for goods and services, while we still have low eastern salaries; I think that the economies of eastern european countries should not continue to be only a source of financial dividends and cheap labor for the economies of western countries and for global corporations; I don't think we should be part of paneuropean and atlantic organizations if we would not treated with respect and if we would just follow foreign orders; I also don't want the standard of living in our individual regions (especially the more peripheral ones) to continue slowly decline, and I've had enough of our elites without a shred of self-reflection who, instead of listening to people's legitimate concerns, isolate themselves in their social bubble and attacks (sometimes very sharply and vulgarly) anyone who dares to express a slightly different opinion and criticize the current situation.

I don't know about you, but if something fundamental doesn't change in our country, maybe I'll stop for a while at the next manifestation too...

Dr. Jan Hachran - main creator of the Slavs in pictures and poetry project

üá¨üáß I STOPPED FOR A WHILE AGAIN

On 28th September, we commemorated St. Wenceslas, the patron saint of the Czech lands, and on that occasion a large patriotic manifestation of ordinary people of different ages and political opinions was held in Prague again, united by concern for our country‚Äôs future and disagreement with the politics of the current liberal government. I have to say that I personally am not a fan of large crowds or passionate chanting, street activism of any kind is not one of my hobbies, however, as a young man who often thinks about what is happening around me, I am not satisfied with the state of our country. And since I had another way around, I stopped again for a while ‚úåüèªüá®üáø

For several years I have had this persistent feeling that many things could be done differently and better. For example, I think that Eastern Europe should not continue to be an insignificant global periphery, where all that is left of the old promises of "western standards of living" are western prices for goods and services, while we still have low eastern salaries; I think that the economies of eastern european countries should not continue to be only a source of financial dividends and cheap labor for the economies of western countries and for global corporations; I don't think we should be part of paneuropean and atlantic organizations if we would not treated with respect and if we would just follow foreign orders; I also don't want the standard of living in our individual regions (especially the more peripheral ones) to continue slowly decline, and I've had enough of our elites without a shred of self-reflection who, instead of listening to people's legitimate concerns, isolate themselves in their social bubble and attacks (sometimes very sharply and vulgarly) anyone who dares to express a slightly different opinion and criticize the current situation.

I don't know about you, but if something fundamental doesn't change in our country, maybe I'll stop for a while at the next manifestation too...

Dr. Jan Hachran - main creator of the Slavs in pictures and poetry project

üá¨üáß On these days (29th - 30th September) we remember the sad event in the history of Czechoslovakia....

Exactly 84 years ago a conference of representatives of nazi Germany (Adolf Hitler), fascist Italy (Benito Mussolini), France (Edouard Daladier) and Great Britain (Neville Chamberlain) were summoned to Munich to solve the so - called "Sudeten question" in the areas of the czechoslovakian border region. The conference was the culmination of the previous events of a century - old dispute between Czechs and the czech Germans, who came in the middle ages to the territory, which has always been ours, as guests at the invitation of the some czech kings, but as humble guests they behaved only sometimes and only some of them. With the establishment of Czechoslovakia a large number of them never reconciled, even though Czechoslovakia as one of the few countries with such a large german minority provided them with all the linguistic and national freedom. In the first CS republic there were thousands of german schools, german radio and the press and in the late twenties their ministers were in our government. But it was not enough for them. 

Since the beginning of the thirties in german - speaking areas began to spread nazi ideas and the result was anti - czech and anti - slavic moods spreaded mostly through the Sudeten german party, which resulted in several serious incidents, when czech families living in mostly german - speaking areas were attacked and lynched, the example is incident in little town Habartov. Czechoslovakia tried to reconcile with them, but the demands of the sudeten Germans led by the nazi Konrad Henlein (who paradoxically, despite their hatred towards the Czechs, was half Czech, because they had a czech mother) were stepping up. Nazi propaganda sent to the world false and fictional reports of alleged terror against the Germans in Czechoslovakia. The Western Powers, which were the guarantors of the establishment of our slavic state, gradually began to cling to the nazi side. In 1938 the situation was rampant  and Czechoslovakia was forced to mobilize, because of nazi military maneuvers. Germany was secretly sent to our territories members of SS, SA and Freikorps, who attacked and killed czech gendarmes and border guards. 

The Western Powers decided to send to Czechoslovakia Lord Runciman's mission to recognize, what is happening in the Czechoslovakia border areas. But he was totally incompetent and unilaterally focused, he was not interested in the situation and essentially his only activities were visits to the spectacles of sudeten german pronazi aristocrats. According to it his final report looked like. In September 1938 Hitler had at the NSDAP congress his fanatical speech full of hatred towards Czechoslovakia, which led to riots and several local uprisings in our border regions. In response to these events a conference of the aforementioned representatives was convened in Munich. The night of 29 and 30 September became the night of treachery. The Western powers, with whom we had allied treaties, to whom we looked up and in whom we hoped in our struggle for freedom and democracy, preyed us to the nazis and forced us to surrender our territory to Germany. On the following day the german military units, which was prepared before, came into the border region enthusiastically celebrated by a large part (not all) of sudeten Germans, who with the Wehrmacht, the SS and the Gestapo began to forcibly expel their czech neighbors. The victims also became german anti - fascists, who fled the from Germany because of nazis or the czech Germans, who were loyal to Czechoslovakia. So the dark epoch of our Homeland began, which was completed by the nazi occupation of our entire territory...

üá¨üáß I STOPPED FOR A MOMENT TOO

On Saturday, one of the largest patriotic manifestations in its modern history took place in the Czech republic, which was attended by 70-100 thousand people. They demonstrated against the current liberal government, which does not adequately solves the rocket growth in prices and living costs, which is pushing many people to the edge of real poverty. However, the manifestation had another dimension, as it drew attention to many long-term unsolved problems, including the decline of our industry and agriculture or the gradual limitation of our national sovereignty. I didn't have so much time to spare, because I was in Prague to finish the preparation of my planned art exhibitions, but I also stopped for a little while ‚úåüèªüá®üáø

You know, I am a person from the northwestern part of the Czech republic, which is a region that has been largely neglected in recent decades. I have the opportunity to perceive many problems first-hand - I walk around closed and crumbling factories every day, I watch how our city is decaying, falling apart, people have no money and entire city districts are engulfed in all sorts of socially pathological phenomena. Municipalities are depopulating, the quality and availability of services decreases in proportion to how their price increases. Everyone has either forgotten about us or is ignoring us. There are several similar regions in our republic (Northern Bohemia, Western Bohemia, Northern Moravia, Silesia and many others) and there are hundreds of them throughout Central and Eastern Europe. It can be said that basically all ordinary Eastern Europeans are such "globalization losers" relegated to the world's periphery, who receive eastern salaries while having to pay western prices. Our culture is also stagnating and decaying and it has been almost completely replaced in recent decades by the uncritical adoption of foreign influences from across the Atlantic ocean. For the reasons mentioned above, I believe that it is time for something to finally change, so that instead of shouting slogans like "We belong to the West!" started to finally do something real that will have a positive impact on people's lives. And this applies not only to the Czech republic, but also to most of the countries of Central and Eastern Europe, where the interests of the ruling elite have completely deviated from the interests of the majority of people...

Dr. Jan Hachran - main creator of the Slavs in pictures and poetry project

üá¨üáß "Warszawianka" (in english known as Whirlwinds of Danger) is a world-famous song of polish revolutionaries and workers, which became popular especially during the protests and strikes in Warsaw between years 1905 - 1907. The territory of the whole tsarist Russia, which at that time included Warsaw and a part of Poland, was then hit by major protests and riots due to the poor social situation after the lost Russo-Japanese war. The song itself was created between 1879 and 1883, its text calling the poor people of Warsaw to resist the ruling class, was written by the polish socialist poet and politician Wac≈Çaw ≈öwiƒôcicki and the music by the composer J√≥zef P≈Çawi≈Ñski ‚öíüáµüá±

Warszawianka later became popular among left-wing movements around the world and was therefore translated into many world languages. Its text was also modified in various ways, creating other versions that differed from the original. The most famous ones were, for example, the soviet version with the same name "–í–∞—Ä—à–∞–≤—è–Ω–∫–∞" (Varshavianka) but with different lyrics, or the spanish republican variation on the same tune called "A las barricadas!" from the times of Spanish Civil War.

You can listen to the song HERE üëâüèª https://youtu.be/CQvoKXdVUuo

üá¨üáß WE STAND FOR THE KOSOVO SERBS

Ethnic tensions flared again in the southern serbian province of Kosovo and Metohija as the self-proclaimed "Kosovo government" made up mostly of ex-members of the terrorist organization U√áK decided to introduce a series of further discriminatory regulations against the serbian population. It must be remembered that one of the constant goals of the constant bullying by the occupying authorities is to force the last remnants of the original slavic population to leave the area. In protest against this, the local Serbs organized a blockade of 2 border crossings in the vicinity of the city of Kosovska Mitrovica, to which the self-proclaimed Kosovo authorities first responded with threats, but then retreated and decided to postpone the planned measures. However, this does not mean a friendly concession, it is only a temporary postponement of the impending conflict, postponement which ultimately does not solve the situation in any way...

In this post (as in previous years) we would like to express our support to the Kosovo Serbs and at the same time encourage them in their fight for freedom. The current world is slowly but surely changing, the influence of Western states is weakening and the unipolar world is gradually becoming multipolar. We believe that, thanks to this development, in the coming years there will be an opportunity to correct the historical injustice committed not only on the serbian nation, but also on the whole Slavdom. KOSOVO IS SERBIA! üá∑üá∏

üá¨üáß GERMANY WANTS TO BUILD THE LARGEST ARMY IN EUROPE - ALREADY FOR THE THIRD TIME

Friends, I don't know what is your opinion, but I am little bit angry about that - after two world wars unleashed by Germany and tens of millions of dead people, the victorious powers have promised us at least twice that this country will not fully arm itself again and something similar will not be repeated. I have to mention the consequences of not keeping this promise for the first time. And now all the commitments regarding the restrictions for Germany have somehow been "forgotten" and, in fact, probably no one can enforce them anymore, because as far as the victorious powers are concerned, the once proud France has degraded itself to the economic pendant of reunited Germany, USA and Britain began shortly after the war to reckon with the idea that an armed Germany within NATO is essentially in their interest, and the two most important successor countries of the Soviet union are currently at war with each other, one of them begging Germany for arms and money, and the other begs for gas consumption. This situation should be particularly worrying for the countries of central, eastern and south-eastern Europe, which have suffered from german colonialism and militarism not only during the world wars but also throughout the whole millennium, when we have repeatedly faced attempts to forcibly seize our countries and to germanize us. To sum it all up, our own history teaches us that a strong Germany is definitely not in the interests of the Slavic world or in the interests of the Czech republic and other central european nations, and therefore we should try our best to prevent its remilitarization‚Ä¶

üá¨üáß Bar√°ƒçn√≠ci or also by the full name Vlastenecko-dobroƒçinn√° obec bar√°ƒçnick√° (in english something like Patriotic-Charitable community of cotters) is a czech patriotic organization established at the time of the national revival as an association of nationally oriented cotters, ie the owners of a smaller village building, to which no field belonged. üá¨üáß On this day (27th May) 80 years ago Operation Anthropoid was launched, when two brave czechoslovakian paratroopers and patriots Jan Kubi≈° and Jozef Gabƒç√≠k assassinated the bloody representative of the nazi occupation power, SS - Obergruppenf√ºhrer and main commander of the Reichsicherheitsdienst Reinhard Heydrich, who was also the author of a nazi plan of liquidation of the Slavs and Jews. Together with another german nazi Karl Herman Frank he also developed a plan for the so - called "final solution of the czech question", which consisted of dividing the czech nation into 3 groups - the first one should be killed, the second one should be drag away behind Ural for slave labor and the third one should be germanized. Following this prepared genocide the Czech lands should be settled by german colonists from the German reich. However, fortunately, not only thanks to the action of our paratroopers, but also due to the german defeat in World War II, it was not realized.

The patriotism and heroism of Kubi≈° and Gabƒç√≠k should inspire us today. No nation is small if it is capable of great deeds and no nation has died until the last person who is fighting for it lives. Honor to their memory üá®üáøüá∏üá∞

In the attached picture you can see a modern reconstruction of the whole event - our paratroopers then waited for Reinhard Heydrich in the corner of Prague's Kobylisy district, where this prominent nazi went to his office every day. As his car passed by, Jan Kubi≈° jumped to its way first, aimed at Heydrich the british submachine gun Sten, but it got stuck and failed at a critical moment. So Jozef Gabƒç√≠k hurried and threw a grenade at the car, the shards of which severely injured Heydrich. Even though he was taken to a nearby hospital, he eventually succumbed to his injuries due to infectious complications‚Ä¶

üá¨üáß Photographs of the polish girl named Czeslawa Kwoka, who was one of hundreds of thousands of polish children murdered in german concentration camps, became one of the symbols of the polish nation's suffering under the german occupation during World War II. Czeslawa, then fourteen, was interned in Auschwitz in 1943 with her mother as a political prisoner. Only reason for their arrest was their polish descent - they came from area of city Zamo≈õƒá, which (according to nazi plans) was to be ethnically cleansed of all Slavs and Jews and subsequently settled by german colonists. According to the participating photographer, the very origin of the photographs was quite dramatic. The girl allegedly cried, was frightened, did not understand why she was imprisoned in the camp, and because she did not speak german, she did not understand the instructions of the shouting camp wardress. She (the wardress) subsequently punched girl in the face several times, causing her the lip injury, which is evident in the photo. Unfortunately, like hundreds of thousands of other slavic and jewish children, Czeslawa did not live to see the end of the war. She died in March 1943, probably after an injection of toxic phenol directly into the heart.

The fate of this girl after the war became a reminder of the worst crimes that the Germans committed during their genocide of the slavic population. So it is our duty to constantly remember these victims and not allow their stories to fall into oblivion‚Ä¶

üá¨üáß In addition to the slavic celebration of love, today (1st May) we also have The labour day commemorating the memory of the workers, who perished during the hard suppression of workers' demonstrations in the United States in the second half of the 19th century.

From the slavic point of view this day reminds us one of the greatest values of our ancestors, which was the work, as the noble act of building our world. So let's stop today for a while and realize, that our civilization has not only created famous persons, who know history, but also many people, whose names we unfortunately do not know, but thanks to their work in fields, factories and elsewhere we can today admire beautiful buildings and cities and live our everyday lives ‚öí

In the picture below we can see an impressive mosaic with the theme of the workers' movement, which can be found in the Buzludzha monument in Bulgaria.

üá¨üáß Dear friends! Even in the current tense and tragic atmosphere of the mutual conflict between two great slavic nations, we should not forget the sad anniversary of the bombing of Yugoslavia by NATO pact, which at the time openly acted as an ally of the U√áK terrorist organization that unleashed terror and ethnic violence in serbian Kosovo province. Although NATO presented it as "struggle for freedom and democracy" and declared combat actions primarily against the yugoslav regime, the reality was that as the primary target of bombing in violation of international law were identified civilians and were used banned weapons, including cluster bombs, depleted uranium bombs and white phosphorus bombs. Thousands of tons of explosives hit Belgrade, but also Podgorica, Kragujevac, ƒåaƒçak and other cities in today's Serbia and Montenegro. Hospitals, schools with children, radio and television buildings, trains, refugee convoys or consumer industry factories were also targeted. The result was tens of thousands of dead, maimed and impoverished people. The western media either completely ignored these crimes or even supported it and encouraged further attacks. None of the western politicians and generals who ordered the bombing (Bill Clinton, Madelaine Albright, Javier Solana, Wesley Clark) were judged for these acts. No economic or political sanctions were imposed on the aggressors or their allies, the U√áK terrorists. In addition, a similar scenario was later repeated with equally devastating results in several other countries, especially in the Middle East‚Ä¶

So let us dedicate today a little memory to the innocent victims of all current and past wars, and above all let us wish the peace. Let us also think about what each of us can do for a world where nations live together in friendship and respect, and where is true justice for all without double standards üïä

P.S .: We do not comment on yugoslav wars between Serbs, Croats and Bosniaks or other conflicts between slavic nations, because we consider them to be fratricidal wars. However, this was a conflict with the U√áK violent organization and there was a gross violation of international law by western powers, which must be unequivocally condemned.

üá¨üáß ‚Äú–ù–∞–≤–µ–∫–∏ –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ‚Äù or in english "Forever together" is the name of an old poster celebrating the friendship between the ukrainian and russian nation. The symbolism of the poster is based on the use of historical motifs and archetypes, as together in traditional clothing there is the zaporozhian cossack (on the right) representing Ukraine üá∫üá¶ and the Moscow shooter from the 16th century (on the left) representing Russia üá∑üá∫

May the message of this poster be fulfilled again, despite the current conflicts, and may the Slavic world finally learn from its mistakes and get rid of the two things which destroy us the most - liberal globalism on the one hand and hateful ultranationalism on the other. üá¨üáß CENTRAL EUROPE HELPS, EUROPEAN MP‚ÄôS HARM

We have announced on our page that we will not comment on the current russian-ukrainian conflict, because we do not comment on mutual conflicts between the slavic nations since the beginning of our page. This rule we have applied to wars in the distant past and also to wars between the nations of Yugoslavia, as well as to the current conflict. However, allow me to make one such remark, which concerns the current conflict, even if it does not directly concern the warring parties. As you know, hundreds of thousands to millions of ukrainian refugees have moved to their country's western borders and they are gradually searching safe space in Poland, Slovakia, the Czech republic and in other countries. Probably most of them are in Poland, which try to receive them and take care of them with dignity.

Surely you will remember a few years ago, when Western countries imported thousands of problematic and culturally incompatible economic migrants, they loudly demanded solidarity and tried to redistribute them to central and eastern european countries at all costs. You will probably still remember all the indiscriminate attacks by western leaders on the countries of central and eastern Europe, when they claimed we are evil, selfish and without sense for solidarity. However, as it turns out, this is not true at all, on the contrary, it reveals the hypocrisy and real goals of western european leaders, who are not interested in helping refugees, but rather in punishing eastern european states (especially Poland and Hungary) who just do not want to blindly listen to foreign orders and instead decided to go their own way. This assumption is confirmed by the events of recent days - almost 1.5 million refugees (mainly women and children) have arrived in Poland in 14 days, which is much more per capita than migrants have come to western Europe in the last decade. And what does the proclaimed western european solidarity looks like in practice? So as you can read below. A vote took place in the European parliament a few days ago. However, if you think that the aim was to enforce proposals to help heavily tested Poland, you are wrong, because the opposite has happened - MEPs from western european countries have abused the current situation and enforced a resolution calling essentially for economic restrictions (maybe it can be called sanctions) against Poland and Hungary for alleged "disrespect for european values ‚Äã‚Äãand the rule of law". It is more than sad that even in the current situation, some mentally immature european MEPs are unable to pass on their antipathy to Poles and Hungarians and their democratically elected governments to the extent that instead of helping in times of crisis, they make political sabotages.

In conclusion, I want to call for help for all Slavs in need, regardless of nationality - do it according to your free choice. In addition, I would also like to call on western european politicians to at least stop with their stupid prejudices and finally to treat Poland, Hungary and other nations of Central and Eastern Europe constructively and with respect‚Ä¶

üá¨üáß As for the current conflict, we would first of all like to say that we feel sad for every needlessly slavic life lost, regardless of nationality, and we hope that peace will soon be restored in Eastern Europe üôèüèªüïä

At the same time, it is a motivation for us, as young researchers and artists, to work even more intensively on building bridges and mutual understanding between Central and Eastern European nations and thus try to remove the 2 things that harm us the most - for firstly, it is domestic ultranationalism that drives us into mutual wars and conflicts, and secondly, it is Western globalism and liberalism that leads to the general spiritual, cultural, demographic and economic decline of our nations. We need to get rid of both of these pathologies if we want to build a happy future for our countries.

In conclusion, we add that we take a neutral position in the whole Russian - Ukrainian conflict and, as a site primarily focused on culture, history and tradition, we will not take anyone 's side and we will not comment further on current events. Let each of you form your own opinion‚Ä¶

üá¨üáß As for the current conflict, we would first of all like to say that we feel sad for every needlessly slavic life lost, regardless of nationality, and we hope that peace will soon be restored in Eastern Europe üôèüèªüïä

At the same time, it is a motivation for us, as young researchers and artists, to work even more intensively on building bridges and mutual understanding between Central and Eastern European nations and thus try to remove the 2 things that harm us the most - for firstly, it is domestic ultranationalism that drives us into mutual wars and conflicts, and secondly, it is Western globalism and liberalism that leads to the general spiritual, cultural, demographic and economic decline of our nations. We need to get rid of both of these pathologies if we want to build a happy future for our countries.

üá¨üáß Two days ago (17th February) we commemorated a sad anniversary for the Slavic world, as it was exactly 14 years since the western powers, in violation of current UN resolutions, created a "state of Kosovo" and handed over this almost sacred serbian territory, where serbian statehood and identity was formed, under the administration of the U√áK terrorist organization. üá¨üáß Support for Novak Djokoviƒá

Serbian tennis player Novak Djokoviƒá is one of the world's best and most successful sportsmen, and in today's tennis he is, without exaggeration, the uncrowned king with a record number of titles and winnings. In addition, he is a man with a wide slavic heart, a philanthropist who annually donates a significant portion of his income to charity in Serbia and elsewhere in the world. In this way, he donated a lot of his money to various charitable projects in Australia, about which we will now talk about and comment on the events that have taken place over the past few days. As is well known, and as those of us who have worked in the West experienced, many Westerners (not all of them) often treat us with undisguised contempt, disrespect and sometimes even open hatred. Their elites often see us as "barbarians from the East" who need to be commanded and who need to be constantly reprimanded and brought up. As we will talk in the following story, even being a world-famous and respected figure will not save you from being treated there this way.

Let's start from the beginning - the famous Australian Open tennis tournament is taking place again in Australia, in which Novak Djokoviƒá has achieved many victories in the past and this year he was supposed to defend last year's title. However, the serbian tennis player is not vaccinated and, as strict restrictions due covid 19 pandemic are currently in place in Australia, in accordance with local immigration rules and applicable laws, he applied for an exemption when issuing the visa. He suffered covid 19 in December 2021, so he got it without problems. However, when he arrived to the country, despite the issued visa, he was illegally restricted in his personal liberty at the airport, arrested and then locked in a detention facility, where illegal immigrants destined for deportation are usually detained. Djokoviƒá with his lawyers lodged an appeal - he first succeeded, but his visa was still revoked by the arrogant australian minister Alex Hawke. In the end, everything went to court, which unfortunately decided against Djokoviƒá. It must be said that the whole affair was accompanied by many inappropriate and poisonous remarks from the australian elites and the media, which seemed to be pleased they could humiliate a successful man from a small eastern european country. The serbian player was basically lured into a kind of pre-arranged trap, he was completely prohibited from participating in the tournament and thus lost the historic opportunity to win a record number of wins in a row. He fell victim to a media and political game of the australian government, which, despite very harsh restrictive measures, fails to stop the covid 19 pandemic, so Novak Djokoviƒá was used as an exemplary case, showing their toughness and uncompromisingness ahead of the upcoming elections. They didn't care that the serbian tennis player had always promoted Australia in a positive spirit all over the world, that he had funded a large number of charitable projects there, and that he had now obeyed all applicable laws - he had fallen another victim of the arrogance, prejudice and maybe also anti-slavic racism of western elites. How else to explain that another tennis player from the USA was admitted to Australia without a problem, even though he is covid 19 positive?

In the end, Novak Djokoviƒá took everything in a sporty way, humbly thanking everyone for support and announcing that he respected the decision of the australian authorities. The arrogant minister Hawke now thinks he has won, and in his own mind he probably considers himself a principled hero; the truth is, however, that he proved to be more of an immoral man abusing his political position, who had discredited his country in abroad. Although Novak Djokoviƒá cannot compete for the title, he is the moral winner of the whole affair‚Ä¶.

P.S .: In this article, we do not comment on the covid 19 vaccination, which we consider to be each person's personal free choice. The main purpose of the post is to criticize the confused and biased approach of the Australian government.

üá¨üáß Today (11th November) is an important day for all Poles, as we commemorate the 103rd anniversary of Poland's re-emergence on the map of Europe after more than a century of foreign rule and its ressurection as an independent free state. üá¨üáß On this day we commemorate the anniversary of the event, which significantly influenced the development and direction of the Slavs in the 20th century. We will leave it up to each of you to assess whether it was a predominantly positive or negative event. After the shots from the cruiser Aurora on 7th November 1917 broke out the Great October Socialist Revolution, which swept the interim government of Alexander Kerensky and instead established a government of Soviets with a dominant representation of the Bolsheviks. The subsequent course of history is known - first in Russia broke out the civil war, which ended in the victory of the Reds, then the USSR was created and eventually all culminated after World War II by establishing the Eastern bloc of socialist states, which included all slavic countries and nations, and which was one of the two strongest power blocs in the world...

In the historical picture below we see one of the celebrations of the anniversary of the revolution on Red square in Moscow

üá¨üáß As slavic traditionalist and a resident of northern Bohemia I have nothing to celebrate about the results of the czech elections (‚ö†Ô∏èwarning: long text)

Done. Elections took place in the Czech lands, the results of which have been widely known since last night, and as I write above, I have no reason to celebrate at all. During reign of previous government it was in many ways dismal, maybe catastrophic, however, in this article I will try to explain in simple points why I consider the winning parties to be a worse option. And I will summarize it from two perspectives, because my worldview is shaped not only by the fact that I consider myself a traditionalist, but also by the fact that I was born and live in northern Bohemia, ie in the predominantly workers' industrial region of our country.

What I'm afraid of as a czech and slavic traditionalist üå±üá®üáø:
‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª despite declarations before the elections, the winning parties support illegal migration; although they now reject this, in my opinion, in the end, attempts to introduce quotas for the redistribution of migrants by the EU will not be hindered by them

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª the victorious parties do not support traditional values, they profess western globalist pop culture; most of their sympathizers openly despise slavic idea and folk traditions

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª they do not support the traditional family, on the contrary, they support LGBT activists and want to promote the marriage of same-sex couples following the example of the West; they consider migration to be the only solution to the low birth rate of the local population

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª proclaim subordination to the EU and a strict orientation to the West, regardless of the fact that westerns societies have been evolving in a completely pathological direction over the last decade

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª their victory will mean the end of the V4 as a dam against stupid ideas from Brussels, because these parties not only harshly criticize Orb√°n's Hungary and Kaczynski's Poland, but even want to punish these states together with the West

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª they support the introduction of the euro, which will further reduce the sovereignty of our country and deprive us of the possibility of elementary control over our currency and thus the economy

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª distort history, their mayors and communal politicians remove monuments to liberators (the case of Marshal Konev's statue in Prague) and instead they build monuments to collaborators with the nazis (Mayor Novotn√Ω's monument for Vlasov army) or to actively promote these collaborators and criminals (glorification of Bandera by parliament member ≈Ω√°ƒçek)

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª their government will probably result in a deterioration of relations with other central and eastern european countries, especially Hungary, Poland, Russia, Belarusia and possibly Serbia

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª in the name of the their fight against alleged hoaxes and against alleged russian propaganda, there is a real threat of restrictions on freedom of expression on the Internet and in public space; as in the West, there will be topics that will not be able to discuss objectively

What am I worried about as a resident of northern Bohemia ‚öí:
‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª the winning parties participated directly or indirectly in the liquidation of many factories in our region in the 1990s, for example in our country in √öst√≠ nad Labem there were approximately 12 functional factories during era of Eastern bloc, today there are barely 2 left plus about 2 new german owned assembly plants, where our people work for low wages

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª the winning parties support the introduction of a EU plan called the Green New Deal, which will be largely a blow to our region dependent on coal mining and electricity generation in coal-fired power plants, and can all end in huge unemployment, poverty, social problems and emphasis on many pathological phenomena that are already bothering our region; without exaggeration, thanks to them, we can end up like american city Detroit

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª in connection with the implementation of the Green New Deal, the prices of energy and fuels will rise sharply, and in connection with this, the prices of all consumer goods, including food too

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª in order to fulfill their promises to reduce the country's spending and indebtedness, they will inevitably have to increase taxes (although they now vehemently deny it); together with the previous point, it will be a catastrophic impact on the living standards of the people in our predominantly workers' region

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª the chairman of the winning party Petr Fiala is infamous for his more than friendly contacts with german extremists and revisionists, especially with the chairman of the Sudetendeutsche Landsmannschaft Bernd Posselt, with whom he promoted the European Union in Moravia in the 1990s; we must therefore prepare for the next wave of apologies to the Germans for post-war deportations, and there is a danger that under the rule of this man, we could start talking about financial compensation from our money to the Germans

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª the winning parties are likely to focus only on the development of metropolitan areas, where they have a majority of their constituents, while our region will continue to remain on the margins of interest among the losers of globalization

In conclusion, I want to say that this is my opinion, which I do not impose on anyone. Feel free to write your own in the comments, I will be happy for other opinions and observations. However, I ask you for a decent and factual discussion. Thank you.

üá¨üáß As slavic traditionalist and a resident of northern Bohemia I have nothing to celebrate about the results of the czech elections (‚ö†Ô∏èwarning: long text)

Done. Elections took place in the Czech lands, the results of which have been widely known since last night, and as I write above, I have no reason to celebrate at all. During reign of previous government it was in many ways dismal, maybe catastrophic, however, in this article I will try to explain in simple points why I consider the winning parties to be a worse option. And I will summarize it from two perspectives, because my worldview is shaped not only by the fact that I consider myself a traditionalist, but also by the fact that I was born and live in northern Bohemia, ie in the predominantly workers' industrial region of our country.

What I'm afraid of as a czech and slavic traditionalist üå±üá®üáø:
‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª despite declarations before the elections, the winning parties support illegal migration; although they now reject this, in my opinion, in the end, attempts to introduce quotas for the redistribution of migrants by the EU will not be hindered by them

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª the victorious parties do not support traditional values, they profess western globalist pop culture; most of their sympathizers openly despise slavic idea and folk traditions

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª they do not support the traditional family, on the contrary, they support LGBT activists and want to promote the marriage of same-sex couples following the example of the West; they consider migration to be the only solution to the low birth rate of the local population

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª proclaim subordination to the EU and a strict orientation to the West, regardless of the fact that westerns societies have been evolving in a completely pathological direction over the last decade

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª their victory will mean the end of the V4 as a dam against stupid ideas from Brussels, because these parties not only harshly criticize Orb√°n's Hungary and Kaczynski's Poland, but even want to punish these states together with the West

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª they support the introduction of the euro, which will further reduce the sovereignty of our country and deprive us of the possibility of elementary control over our currency and thus the economy

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª distort history, their mayors and communal politicians remove monuments to liberators (the case of Marshal Konev's statue in Prague) and instead they build monuments to collaborators with the nazis (Mayor Novotn√Ω's monument for Vlasov army) or to actively promote these collaborators and criminals (glorification of Bandera by parliament member ≈Ω√°ƒçek)

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª their government will probably result in a deterioration of relations with other central and eastern european countries, especially Hungary, Poland, Russia, Belarusia and possibly Serbia

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª in the name of the their fight against alleged hoaxes and against alleged russian propaganda, there is a real threat of restrictions on freedom of expression on the Internet and in public space; as in the West, there will be topics that will not be able to discuss objectively

What am I worried about as a resident of northern Bohemia ‚öí:
‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª the winning parties participated directly or indirectly in the liquidation of many factories in our region in the 1990s, for example in our country in √öst√≠ nad Labem there were approximately 12 functional factories during era of Eastern bloc, today there are barely 2 left plus about 2 new german owned assembly plants, where our people work for low wages

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª the winning parties support the introduction of a EU plan called the Green New Deal, which will be largely a blow to our region dependent on coal mining and electricity generation in coal-fired power plants, and can all end in huge unemployment, poverty, social problems and emphasis on many pathological phenomena that are already bothering our region; without exaggeration, thanks to them, we can end up like american city Detroit

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª in connection with the implementation of the Green New Deal, the prices of energy and fuels will rise sharply, and in connection with this, the prices of all consumer goods, including food too

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª in order to fulfill their promises to reduce the country's spending and indebtedness, they will inevitably have to increase taxes (although they now vehemently deny it); together with the previous point, it will be a catastrophic impact on the living standards of the people in our predominantly workers' region

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª the chairman of the winning party Petr Fiala is infamous for his more than friendly contacts with german extremists and revisionists, especially with the chairman of the Sudetendeutsche Landsmannschaft Bernd Posselt, with whom he promoted the European Union in Moravia in the 1990s; we must therefore prepare for the next wave of apologies to the Germans for post-war deportations, and there is a danger that under the rule of this man, we could start talking about financial compensation from our money to the Germans

‚ÄºÔ∏èüëâüèª the winning parties are likely to focus only on the development of metropolitan areas, where they have a majority of their constituents, while our region will continue to remain on the margins of interest among the losers of globalization

In conclusion, I want to say that this is my opinion, which I do not impose on anyone. Feel free to write your own in the comments, I will be happy for other opinions and observations. However, I ask you for a decent and factual discussion. Thank you.

üá¨üáß The media lynch of czech children - the new bottom of anti-slavic racism in Britain

Western states are very strange in many ways. On the one hand, due to exaggerated political correctness, there are many groups whose behavior is forbidden to criticize, to the extent that (as has recently surfaced) police, media and politicians let ethnic grooming gangs to brutally abuse british working-class girls for 20 years without intervening in any way because they feared accusations of racism (sources can be found in the comments); on the other hand, there are groups that are everyday literally ridiculed and bullied by the british media, politicians and ordinary citizens. This groups include, for example, also us Slavs or Eastern Europeans in general. British society is unfortunately largely permeated by anti-slavic systemic racism to the extent that swearing at Eastern Europeans or directly verbally insulting or physically attacking them is a popular pastime among many simpler individuals. In my personal opinion, this is due to the fact that the Britons show a considerable degree of incompetence, unwillingness and impotence in solving serious social problems caused by citizens from their former colonies, and therefore pour out their growing frustration on czech waitress, polish plumber, russian or ukrainian construction worker or romanian truck driver.

Probably the worst intensity ever reached this hatred now, when czech children have become the target of an indiscriminate media lynching. And what actually happened? It all started with a match between the czech football team AC Sparta and the scottish team Glasgow Rangers. This club from the British Isles and its players have been infamous in our country for a long time, because during the last guest appearance they behaved cruelly during a match with another Prague club SK Slavia, injured several of our players and everything culminated when Glasgow player Glen Kamara physically attacked football player Ond≈ôej K√∫dela. Whoever thinks that justice has subsequently been achieved is wrong. The Glasgow footballers could not bear the fact that, despite their unsportsmanlike and aggressive style, they lost, and therefore they accused K√∫dela of alleged racism against the above-mentioned Kamara. Although the accusation was purposeful, there was no evidence, witnesses spoke in favor of czech footballer and his teammates of african origin openly defended him, the UEFA football association finally punished our player and our club hypocritically in the spirit of systemic anti-slavic racism. As if that wasn't enough, the Glasgow Rangers supporters launched a hateful anti-czech campaign in Britain. Thanks to all this, the scottish club has earned the worst possible reputation among the czech people and provoked a wave of negative reactions. However, the whole case now has its continuation. As mentioned above, another match has now taken place between the czech club AC Sparta and the Glasgow Rangers, with the audience being mainly children's fans. British footballers were already encouraging to aggressive behavior by their supporters, and one of them wrote that if they did not win over the Czechs, then at least get them to the hospital (see the screen in the comments). The Rangers behaved in this way even now, and Kamara himself received a red card from the referee for an elbow attack directly in the face of the czech player. It is well known that children as innocent and guileless creatures have a more developed sense of fair play than most adults, so in response to Kamara's behavior in the past and during the match, they began to whistle on him quite intensely, which is not uncommon in sports matches. It is necessary to add that the children did not whistle at the player in any case because he is dark-skinned, but because of his behavior. What it has subsequently triggered cannot be called anything other than the absolute bottom of british racism. Some of the british and especially scottish commentators, including the official media, began distributing photos of czech children with disgusting comments over the Internet and social media. For example, one of them likened the parents of czech children to a bowl of rotten fruit and supplemented his post with photographs of mold. Others did not spare children with vulgar insults with fecal or sexual overtones. Just something low and barbaric that has no place in civilized Europe.

Our project sees this as the bottom of anti-slavic racism, and we officially call on czech politicians and czech diplomacy to respond. At the same time, we call on the part of the british public that is not yet affected by growing hatred to prevent further public lynching and cyberbullying of children. Otherwise, we tell the entire Glasgow Rangers and its supporters, "Think about yourself, and when you realize what you're doing and how you're behaving, officially apologize to everyone you've hurt!"
